questions.question: Get me the file ………………………… is on the table.
questions.description: Either which or that can be used in identifying relative clauses to refer to things.

questions.question: The house ………………………. she lived was very small.
The boy …………………………. fell into the well was rescued.
questions.description: We use who to refer to people when the relative pronoun is the subject of the relative clause.

questions.question: The girl ………………………….. we met at the library is an aspiring writer.
questions.description: We use whom when the relative pronoun is the object of the relative clause.

questions.question: Ravi, ……………………….. is my nephew, is  a brilliant student.
questions.description: That cannot be used in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: This is the dog ………………………… I was talking about.
questions.description: Either that or which can refer to animals in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: The exhibition ………………………….. was held in the town hall attracted tens of thousands of people.
Where are the books ………………………. I left on the table?
questions.description: Either that or which can refer to things in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: The man ………………………… car was stolen went to the police.
I know a girl …………………………. brother serves in the army.
